value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>But</del> <del>But</del> <del>As for</del> <del>It is against that</del> He shuffles his pages</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">with <del>those heroic figures</del> these are the great figures</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that surround the peasants; the pilgrims; the singers; –</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But <del>he sees that</del> The wandering singer, the [beginner?]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">who sings to the dairy maids at the back door</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">makes no show against those Greeks & Romans.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>But</del> <del>But he shows us the actual house;</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>which has been built</del>  But there is England itself,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the <del>village, with</del> the [forest?] as been felled; the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">hut has given place to the house; the house has</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">windows, chimneys, pillows, & silver jugs:</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>the smok</del> And there is <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-lond" key="London">London</rs>; with its</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-gren" key="Greenwich">Greenwich</rs> & the <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-eliz" key="Elizabeth I">queen</rs>; & a few ships: &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& there, though he cannot see himself, is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Harrison, a [illeg.] yet kindly man,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">obsessively addressing his patron, <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wcob" key="Cobham, William">Lord Cobham</rs></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">rooted to his <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-radw" key="Radwinter">Radwinter</rs> in <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-esse" key="Essex">Essex</rs> <del>with a</del> owning a</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">mastiff; <del>He</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">English had gone downstairs, into the kitchen, into the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">farmyard.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">& more painful. For they reminded him of his lack of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">birth; <del>of his [illeg.] his mind</del></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">When he looks back, he does not see <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-gcha" key="Chaucer, Geoffrey">Chaucer</rs>, <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-jlyd" key="Lydgate, John">Lydgate</rs>,</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-jwyc" key="Wycliffe, John">Wycliffe</rs>, <del>he does not</del> <add place="above">Not</add> the plain 
            <choice>
              <sic>unmetaphoracal</sic>
              <corr>unmetaphorical</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">language to which we [illeg.], in claiming</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">an ancestor, was <del>to him</del> not <del>the</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Chaucer is not his ancestor, as he is ours; he looks</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>When</del> His ancestors, by way of the mind, are the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Greeks or the Romans. – <del>The</del> <del>Bible</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">In the background of his mind [strained?] the old</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[facts?] <del>~</del> They occupied the same place in</l>
